characters: ...INSTEAD ANNA IS TWISTING THE CORKSCREW DEEPER AND DEEP
AS THE FLASHBACK PLAYS OUT IN FULL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a train’s mournful clatter as trees flash by and the train itself passes in a silvery streak. A woman draws an “x” on her foggy window-- looking out through it directly at us: This is RACHEL and she is THE GIRL ON THE TRAIN.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (SOFT V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..-My husband used to tell me I have an overactive imagination. I can’t help it. I mean, haven’t you ever been on a train and wondered about the lives of the people who live near the tracks? The lives you've never lived. RACHEL’S POV: Out the window: A series of backyards slowl passes: A MAN walks towards his front yard. An OLDER MAN works on a vintage car in his yard. CHILDREN slide down playground equipment. A LONE BOY throws a ball. His dog chases after it.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: These are things I want to know. Rachel sits alone, sketching in a small notebook. CLOSE ON: Rachel’s expectant eyes as the train begins to slow.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: «+. Twice a day I sit in the third car from the front where I have the perfect view into my favorite house: Number 15 Beckett Road... RACHEL’S POV: Standing on the upstairs deck of a house, a gorgeous blonde, MEGAN, wears a light opened robe with on white underwear and bra underneath. She stretches her bac like a cat. Her curved silhouette is intoxicating. The train comes to a brief stop at the station and, outsi the other window, Rachel can see work crews fixing the tracks. And beyond them, the Hudson River. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...I don’t know when exactly. I suppose I started noticing her about a year ago and, gradually, as the months went past, she became important to me... As the train creeps forward RACHEL SPOTS-- A BLUE HOUSE WITH A WHITE PICKET FENCE... .--She quickly averts her eyes from the view of the house repressing an inner pain. Focusing on her sketch book. Rachel's eyes land on a MAN IN A SUIT, red hair, 50, past and plain-- typing on a laptop. He looks up at Rachel. Th is something disconcerting about the exchange.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m not the girl I used to be. I think people can see it on my face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's profile has flipped: she now rides in the opposi direction, on the EVENING TRAIN. She watches the familiar houses glide past. RACHEL’S POV: This evening, Megan sits with her equally beautiful husband, SCOTT next to a backyard fire pit. Each holds a glass of wine. The roaring fire glows on the faces as they watch the passing train. SCOTT spins Megan around and begins to kiss her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She's what I lost. She’s everything I want to be... Rachel returns to her sketchbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headed back to New York, Rachel POV: Rachel stares at the burnt out fire pit behind 15 Beckett Road. Megan is on the balcony in her robe while Scott rakes lea CLOSE ON: Scott as he looks up from raking and seems to l directly at Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's train arrives and she wades through a sea of commuters in the Grand Hall. She wears a plain dress and carries a work satchel.

dialogues.speaker: STATION ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...now departing track nineteen, upper level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits in a row of chairs getting her shoes shined. She’s the only woman among eight male customers. Rachel sketches in her sketch book and sips from a squirt bottle.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...I imagine she’s a painter... She's creative. CLOSE ON SKETCH PAD: We see Rachel’s hand at work as she produces a beautiful images of Megan and Scott.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He’s a doctor or an architect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits at the counter continuing to draw in her sket book. The restaurant is bustling with tourists and locals

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He has a good laugh. She can’t cook.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: (to customer) Do you need anything else right now?

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: No. I think we’re pretty good, thanks. Rachel is lost in her imagination. All sounds of the bust bar fade away. Rachel eats an olive from her martini.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I wonder what they say to each other before they go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cityscape slowly spins below us as we find the train the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's profile has flipped again: she rides the EVENING TRAIN and watches as she passes the urban landscape of Harlem.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Today her name is “Jess,” tomorrow it could be “Lisa” or “Amber.” It all depends on the day, it depends on my mood. Later that night, as the train slows, Rachel nears the bl house (23 Beckett Road). She looks to her lap, letting it pass. She raises her head and looks at Number 15 Beckett Road. ..-NOW, Megan and Scott can be seen kissing through the window of their house.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: The truth is, I don’t know her name. I don’t know if she paints or whether he has a good laugh. I just know they know love... RACHEL'S POV: Megan and Scott begin to make love.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sometimes I catch myself trying to remember the last time I had meaningful contact with another person... Rachel stays on the couple then an irresistible urge pull her gaze back to the blue house two doors down. This time, when the Blue House (23 Beckett Road) appears, Rachel refuses to turn her gaze away. RACHEL’S POV: The upstairs window of the Blue House. In i Rachel sees herself! Standing in the window in the light day.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I used to live two doors down... number 13 Beckett Road. It was my first home. We bought it together. It was ours. RACHEL’S MEMORY: Rachel, in the Blue House, turns from t window to come face to face with a handsome man, TOM. The smile and laugh as Rachel grabs him. He kisses her passionately as they enjoy their empty, NEWLY-PURCHASED H BACK ON THE TRAIN: Rachel blinks: she is still looking at blue house.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Every day, I tell myself not to look. RACHEL’S POV: NOW, in reality, a woman, ANNA, stands in t window holding a BABY, EVIE.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But then I look... Rachel watches as Anna becomes a tiny dot that vanishes i the distance.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you alone? Rachel looks up to see a Woman holding a one-year-old lit boy. And now the moment of truth for Rachel:

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (polite) Yeah. She pats the seat next to her and takes her bag from it.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No, come. It’s all yours. Rachel smiles at the child.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Your baby’s so cute. (to boy) Hi, baby.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Is it... Is it a boy?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: So sweet. How...how old is he?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Six months.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Six months. Rachel softly squeezes the boy’s hand and giggles. The Wo begins to pick up on Rachel’s slurred speech and notices little empty vodka bottles at the mouth of Rachel’s purse

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: So sweet. Rachel realizes the Woman knows she is drunk. The Woman repositions her child away from Rachel. CLOSE ON: Rachel’s eyes, bleary, blink in slow motion. Rachel, now seated alone, drinks from her squirt bottle.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Title: MEGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Living Portrait: MEGAN, the woman Rachel watches from t train-- up close and drop-dead gorgeous. OVERHEAD SHOT: Megan lies face up on a Pilates machine. She grips the hand straps, and with precision and grace, begins a series of exercises, stretching her body like a ballerina’s.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) A teacher once told me I was a mistress of self-reinvention... We widen to see she is lined up with ten other suburban women. With both admiration and defeat, a FRUSTRATED WOMA observes Megan’s flexibility and strength.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) ...-I wasn’t really sure what it meant at the time. But since moving here I’ve come to understand it...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Title: 6 MONTHS AGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the sidewalk, the women from class have congregated, a chatting happily, occasionally cutting looks towards Mega who takes no notice as she starts to jog away. We see her running down our quaint Ardsley Village street.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) Ardsley-on-Hudson is boring and routine. It’s a fucking baby factory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan jogs into a long dark underpass linking the outside world to Beckett.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) I want to start my life over again. So far, I’ve been: rebellious teenager, lover, waitress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan continues down Beckett Road and jogs up her drivewa INT. MEGAN’S HOUSE - LATER THAT MORNING Megan stands in front of an open closet. Her ivory hand d between silk blouses and skirts.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .--gallery director, nanny, and... a whore... (a moment) And not necessarily in that order. Scott approaches, slides his hands down Megan’s side, the her skirt to remove her panties. They begin to have sex against the open closet.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) I can’t just be a wife anymore. She is disconnected, disinterested. Scott doesn’t notice.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) That's why I stay awake at night, staring at the ceiling.  INT. DR. ABDIC’S OFFICE - DAY CLOSE ON: MEGAN’S FACE AS SHE TALKS TO SOMEONE:

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: ...In fact, the only time I feel like myself is when I’m running.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You always felt that way?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Maybe since I was about seventeen. With Mac.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mac? Who’s Mac?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: My brother’s best friend. My brother who died... We finally see the extremely handsome, dark-haired man wh sits across from Megan. This is DR. KAMAL ABDIC. He’s for with a quiet command. She has been speaking to him the wh time. She smiles. She covers her mouth with her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I tend to smile when I’m nervous. Sometimes, I laugh. She moves from her chair to a couch across the room. A moment passes. Finally, the Doctor’s inviting silence elicits Megan’s confession:

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: For a year, Mac and I lived in this hunting cabin. We started fucking. We were the saddest people we knew. But in a way, that cabin made us happy. No one could find us. (a moment) Everyone thought we were dead.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: And if you were to run away today, right now, where would you go? Megan glances outside, where she can see the train passin The Doctor notices. Megan moves again, to sit much closer him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I read once that when a train hits, it can rip the clothes right off of you. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I’m pretty sure Scott thinks the nanny job is gonna make me less restless-- make me wanna get pregnant...

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: And that’s not the case?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: When I finish work every night, I run home, and I get in the shower and wash the smell of that baby off me as fast as I can. Megan stares at Abdic. He waits for her to continue, but just looks at him with great intensity. PRE-LAP: A gentle lullaby, and the sound of splashing wat A baby's giggle.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Title: ANNA

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Title: TODAY INT. TOM AND ANNA’S HOUSE - BATHROOM - DUSK A living portrait: ANNA, pure and sweet, with dimples for days, looks down into the camera with absolute love.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: ...When you woke up this morning I went and I brought you back to bed with me... Anna kneels on the tiled floor, leaning over the bathtub, gently washing her baby, EVIE.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: ...-And when I was feeding you. We heard daddy singing from the kitchen, didn’t we? (sung to her baby) “Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday dear Anna, Happy Birthday to you!” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Megan, her nanny, steps out of the dark shadow, holding a towel for Anna to place her baby into.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Daddy came upstairs with a beautiful breakfast that he made for Mommy, didn’t he? Yes he did. (noticing Megan) Thank you, Megan. Anna places her baby into Megan’s arms.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: There you go. INT. TOM AND ANNA’S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER Megan hands the swaddled baby to Anna who now lays in her bed. Anna sits Evie on her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (to Evie) Oh, hello. Anna laughs as she tickles Evie and turns to Megan.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I swear I sometimes feel like my heart is gonna explode. I mean, look at her. (laughing) Look at her! The phone rings. Megan goes to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (to Evie, playful) You're not sleeping! You’re not sleeping...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (on phone) Hello? Hello? Anita’s interest is piqued. She takes Evie into the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds Megan on the hallway phone.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Hello...? Megan pushes the END button on the phone. Anna steps into hall. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Is that another hang-up?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: ...Mm-hmm. Anna, visibly shaken, tries not to get upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna has Megan help her fold a fitted sheet.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: .»..and grab the corners. And straighten.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I got another job. Anna is blindsided.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: +..You what?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I’m really sorry, Anna.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (confused) I thought you were happy here. I mean, you seemed happy here...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I am. It’s just this isn’t what I “do.”

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: ...Take care of children...? Megan drops the folded sheet onto a pile.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Or laundry. (beat) Another gallery head-hunted me.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (trying to be positive) ...That's great.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: The thing is, it starts tomorrow. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I’m out all day tomorrow. That is so uncool.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I hate to leave you like this, without childcare, but...you don’t have a job. Anna turns away, insulted.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Ok, that sounded wrong. I know that you're busy volunteering...

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: It’s not the volunteering. It’s all the shopping, it’s spending hours in the farmer's market, it’s finding the right foods for her, it’s pureeing sweet potatoes. And I do all of this at the same time as I’m nursing. Megan looks at Anna carefully. Anna is exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Maybe you should go back to work, too. Mothers need to work, it’s actually better for the kid...

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: How would you know? That was a low blow. Megan absorbs it, hurt, then gently her set of keys down on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Your key.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: There is no job more important than raising a child... Megan heads out of the kitchen towards the front door.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (defeated) Megan, please... Megan exits without turning.  13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna stirs from a nap on the couch to the sound of Evie crying...coming from outside. She races to the open front door in a panic. EXT. TOM AND ANNA’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Anna emerges from the house, frightened, and rushes forwa

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Rachel? What are you doing? Give me my baby. We see Rachel standing in the middle of the yard, cradlin Evie.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Rachel, what are you doing?! INT. TOM AND ANNA’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Close on Anna, reliving what we realize was a memory.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello? Tom enters. We recognize him as the Man from Rachel’s mem on the train. He hands Anna some flowers and groceries and kisses her sweetly on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (re: flowers) Thank you... Beautiful. She notices that he’s on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: How many times has she texted you today?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (frustrated) I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (unable to relax) She called the landline three times.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Wow. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You have to have a talk with her.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: It’s getting crazy.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I will. I know I know I know.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Okay. Tom cups Anna’s face gently in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It’s going to be fine. Isn’t it always fine? Don’t I always make everything fine?... Anna won't smile. He playfully pokes at her lips until sh laughs. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Who gives a shit? It’s your birthday. You sure you don’t want me to take you out tonight?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No, I like it at home. He opens a beer and sets the magnetic corkscrew/bottle op on the fridge door before hopping onto the counter.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Call Megan. Ask her to come back.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: She just quit.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: She what?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: .--She just told me she got another job.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: ...Shame. I thought you guys were kind of a good team together...

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: So did I.  15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars of the train slowly pass-- the glow of the windo lighting up the commuters in their seats. And here is Rac looking out. INT. ANNA’S FAMILY ROOM - SAME NIGHT The camera hovers outside the window, looking in at Anna eats a candlelit takeout birthday dinner with Tom and Evi Tom pulls out his phone and snaps a picture. INT. MEGAN’S BATHROOM - SAME NIGHT Megan stands at the plate glass window that lines her sho stall. She looks out at the moonlight that casts itself across the Hudson River. Water beats down on her. EXT. RACHEL’S STREET - SAME NIGHT Exiting the train station, Rachel walks towards her home, wide eyes sighing as they take in the bleak Croton landsc INT. ANNA’S BEDROOM - SAME NIGHT OVERHEAD WIDE SHOT: Anna and Tom are in bed. Tom is sound asleep, but Anna is wide-awake. INT. MEGAN’S BATHROOM - SAME NIGHT The camera floats behind Megan as a naked Scott steps int the stall and kisses her. EXT. RACHEL’S STREET - SAME NIGHT Rachel enters a liquor store. INT. MEGAN’S BATHROOM - SAME NIGHT Scott has Megan pressed against the glass shower door as has sex with her from behind. INT. RACHEL’S BEDROOM - SAME NIGHT Rachel sits in bed. She finds TOM’S FACEBOOK PAGE on her laptop. She stares at the photo Tom took earlier that nig of he and Anna laying next to Evie. The caption reads: I'VE NEVER KNOWN LOVE LIKE THIS! ME AN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ANNA’S BEDROOM - SAME NIGHT Tom's phone buzzes. Anna sits up in bed and can see the caller ID reads: “RACHEL”. She angrily shoves the phone o the dresser and slumps back into bed. INT. RACHEL’S APARTMENT - SAME NIGHT CLOSE ON: A cellphone sits on the counter, dialing on speaker. Rachel pours a glass of white wine. VERY DRUNK. Tom’s voicemail picks up:

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (outgoing message) Hey, it’s Tom. Sorry I missed you. I'll get right back to ya!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hey, Tom, it's me. I just wanted to wish Momma a happy birthday. "Happy birthday, Momma--” CATHY, Rachel’s roommate, appears, grabs Rachel’s phone a presses END.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: Rachel! Jesus... Cathy pours the wine down the sink. Rachel grabs at the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No no no. No, don’t, Cathy. Please stop it! Cathy, come on! But Cathy easily fends her off.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: Relax, relax. Unsteady, Rachel nods and softens.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I just need something to go to sleep. I just need a little bit to go to sleep. Cathy gently guides Rachel towards her room.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: What brought this on? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He posted another picture of the baby. It was a cute picture.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: Yeah? Facebook and drunk ex-wives do not make good friends. Offended by the implication, Rachel pulls away from Cathy

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I got it. I got it.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: Alright. I’1l just get you to your room. They've arrived at Rachel’s room. INT. RACHEL’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Rachel crawls into the bed looking around her small room.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: Rachel, you have to stop calling them. Okay? Rachel nods. She reaches up to pull Cathy to sit beside h

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I really appreciate this room. I do. I thought that I would just be here for a couple of weeks or a month.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: (abrupt) Yeah. That was two years ago. But she shakes her head and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: Get some sleep. Cathy switches off the light and leaves. Rachel looks at phone. INSERT: Rachel’s outgoing call log screen reads: TOM (11) Rachel looks over the times: 11:02, 11:12, 11:54, 12:09. lets out a sigh. INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE - DAY - RACHEL’S MEMORY Rachel and Tom sit in a DOCTOR’s office, distraught. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: IVF rarely works the first time. Would you like a moment? Tom takes Rachel’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It's okay, sweetie. We’re gonna try again.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We can’t afford to do it again.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Well, when we can, we will. She rests her head on his shoulder. He kisses it. INT. RACHEL’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Rachel stirs in her bad and a new memory intrudes. EXT. SCOTT AND MEGAN’S HOUSE - NIGHT Rachel remembers Scott and Megan snuggling outside by the fire pit, kissing. INT. RACHEL’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Rachel finally sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train surges by along the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel rides the train as it barrels past homes and buildings. Rachel reaches into her purse and pulls out a tube of lipstick. She brings it to her lips, but quickly realizes that she can’t steady her hands enough to put it on. So, almost by rote, she puts it away. Rachel catches eyes with the MAN IN THE SUIT. The Man sha his head in judgement and raises a magazine to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From high above, the train crawls along the riverside.  19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL’S POV OUT THE WINDOW: Rachel sees Megan alone on h porch, looking out at the train...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I wonder what she’s looking at... Or if she even sees this train at all. ..-Rachel gives a little smile. A moment of reprieve from troubled mind... NOW, SOMETHING PECULIAR HAPPENS... ...a DARK-HAIRED MAN steps onto the porch, and embraces Megan. CLOSE ON: Rachel blinks. The train stops at the station, allowing Rachel a closer look. The Dark-Haired Man’s face is obscured in the shadows, BU IS NOT SCOTT...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Who is that man? AND THEN THEY KISS. The train begins moving again and Rachel quickly jumps to feet...

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The next station is: Ardsley-on- Hudson. ...-Rachel pushes her way up the aisle, blocked by a few people who have just boarded the train. With every few steps Rachel takes, she manages to see ano sliver of the view of Megan and the Dark-Haired Man. Rachel enters the next car, running to keep her view as t train departs. BOOM! Another train barrels by in the opposite direction, totally obscuring Rachel’s view. A familiar ache fills Rachel’s chest. She bends over, fee sick.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What is she doing?  20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel exits her train with scores of other commuters, looking numb. She’s bombarded by images, fast cuts of: - Megan and the man kissing. We recognizes him as Dr. Abd - Glimpses of a laptop, displaying an email with the subj

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN GRAND CENTRAL TERMINAL
dialogues.text: Devastated, Rachel walks toward the Grand Hall. She passe the window of a liquor store. She slows.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She's throwing it all away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel pours a bottle of vodka into her empty squirt bott and throws the vodka bottle into the garbage. It shatters

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits before a beautiful bronze sculpture of three dancing maidens holding hands and joyfully dancing in a circle. Nearby, a BOY drums on a plastic bucket. Rachel sips from her squirt bottle. She flashes to Megan and Abdic kissing... then to her res her head on Tom’s shoulder at the clinic. And then to the email. We get a cleaner view. It’s a chai between Tom and Anna. INT. TOM AND ANNA’S HOUSE - DAY RACHEL’S MEMORY: Rachel sits in front of an open laptop staring at the email as Tom’s voice reads it.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Anna, I fell asleep last night thinking of you. I dreamed about kissing the inside of your thighs. Holding your breasts. God, I wish I was fucking you right now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel slams the laptop closed and hurls it against the bedroom wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna walks alone, overcome by tears, trying to banish the memories.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Anna, I love you. I love you so much.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) When it happened to me, I found dozens of emails. Tom told her that he’d never felt like this before. He said it wouldn’t be that much longer until they were together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits at the lunch counter drinking a martini. She speaks to another patron. A WOMAN, 70, who is drinking al as well.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I know what they say: “You shouldn’t check his email.” I was stupid. But when I saw it was from the realtor I thought that it was just spam. And then I realized that they were kisses not Xs and my husband was fucking a Century 21 Agent. She laughs at the absurdity.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: That sucks.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It does. Her name was Anna Boyd and he was in love with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-ON: Rachel runs lipstick over a mirror, creating a xX XXX xX. She turns from the mirror where the woman is standing and watching her. Rachel raises her phone in front of them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (drunk whisper to woman) Come here for one second. Say "fuck you, Anna Boyd", but just yell it. The woman nods. Rachel turns on the phone's video. Togeth they shout into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL /WOMAN
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Anna Boyd! Rachel sets the phone down on the edge of the sink. The p still recording video as she continues her rant.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That bitch is living in my house. I picked everything in that house. I picked everything. I picked the dining table, the kitchen table. I wonder if she knows that I fucked Tom on the same table that her baby eats at. I just want to tell her. I wish I could tell her. I picked everything in that house. I fucking picked everything in that house! Rachel turns back to the mirror. Her energy has shifted, there's an anger rising within her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: ...I could never find the words to describe how I felt when I read that e-mail, but this morning, I did. I did. When I saw that woman kissing someone else, betraying her husband, I felt it. I felt... Pure. Rage. Slowly the Camera pushes into Rachel’s naked face as the sound of the bar vanish.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: ...-Like something has been taken from ME again. If I could... If I could, I’d just go to her house. And I'd go in and find her sitting at the kitchen table. I’d wrap my hand in her long blonde hair and jerk her head back. Just jerk it back! And then I’d pull her down to the ground and I would just smash her head all over the floor! Rachel smears the lipstick Xs into oblivion in her rage. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hold. Rachel stands alone in the middle of the bathroom, nobody listening, in total SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, her eyes alive with a drunken mission, stands on packed train, her body sways with the train’s rhythms. Sh sucks down vodka from her squirt bottle. SIXTY SCHOOL CHILDREN DRESSED IN UNIFORM fill the car. Rambunctious and loud, their noise consumes the train. One YOUNG GIRL catches Rachel’s eye, regarding her frankl Rachel looks around and it seems like everyone is staring her. Rachel's gaze careens out the window trying to see into Megan’s house. The image of Megan kissing Abdic flashes in her vision ov and over. The train slows to a stop. Rachel suddenly pushes her way through the crowd to get off the train, pushing through t kids and other commuters who block her way.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Move! Get out of my way! Move! Rachel runs down the aisle and gets off the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel’s feet HIT the platform and she stumbles forward, oblivious to conversations going on around her. She quick picks herself up and runs down the side of the train as t engine screams past her. CLOSE ON: Rachel's face is pale. THE MAN IN THE SUIT stares at Rachel from across the platform. She opens her mouth to say something to him, bu the words keep evaporating off her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel leaves the station and looks ahead through the ARC THE UNDERPASS-- the dark tunnel. She is driven onward by Man, who seems to be following her. She drunkenly cuts off the road into the woods, but conti towards the underpass. Something inexplicable pulls her forward. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In a mad trance, Rachel hears the click-click-click of hi heels, and sees a BLONDE WOMAN striding purposefully into underpass. Is it Anna?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey!!! She chases the woman into the dark underpass, sees the woman’s red jacket moving further away, and bellows out:

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You whore! She is suddenly swallowed by the SCREAM OF BLACKNESS. INT. RACHEL’S BEDROOM - SAME MOMENT RACHEL'’S POV: Details come slowly into focus. An empty v bottle. The overturned squirt bottle. Rachel’s hand, with dirt under the fingernails. Her sweater, matted with bloo the shoulder. Her phone, also flecked with blood. Rachel stirs painfully and we see her hair matted with bl as well. She reaches for the phone. A voicemail from Tom plays over the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (on speaker phone) Jesus Christ, Rachel! What the hell is wrong with you? I’ve spent the past hour driving around looking for you! You scared the shit out of Anna, do you know that? CLOSE ON: Rachel’s fingers run across her scalp. She trie separate some of the bloody strands.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (on speaker phone) She thought you were going to...she wanted to call the police. So just leave us alone! Rachel sits up in bed. She looks to the floor and sees he open purse with its contents strewn on the shag rug. Blood droplets stain the rug next to her jeans and pantie

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (on speaker phone) You can ruin your own life if you want to, but you’re not gonna destroy ours. I’m not gonna protect you any more. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She catches a horrific sight in the mirror across the roo It’s a woman with large streaks of dried blood smeared do her face-- staring back at her! Rachel realizes that she is looking at HERSELF.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. RACHEL’S BATHROOM - SECONDS LATER Rachel frantically washes the blood from her face.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh my god... CLOSE ON: Rachel digs the dirt out from her fingernails. She looks at herself in the mirror. With the blood gone, can see the bruises that mottle her arms and legs.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rachel, open the door.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Cathy, I just need a sec.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: Are you ok? Rachel, open the door. Rachel abruptly opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I have a stomach flu, okay?

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: You don’t have a flu. What the fuck, Rachel? I’m not stupid-- Cathy slams the door and returns to the mirror. Cathy KNO

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: Rachel!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Cathy, just go away! INT. RACHEL’S BATHROOM - SAME DAY The camera hovers behind Rachel’s back as she sits naked the edge of the bathtub, holding herself and watching the video of her drunken rant. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (on phone) ...Fuck you, Anna Boyd! RACHEL TRIES TO REMEMBER — FLASH - The Man in the Suit races towards us. FLASH - Rachel screams out to the woman.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You whore! FLASH - A blonde woman falls to a kitchen floor. FLASH - Rachel runs through the underpass. FLASH - TEENS blow smoke into Rachel’s face. FLASH - Rachel lies halfway in a drainage ditch flowing b the underpass.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Rachel slowly lowers herself into the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Rachel during her morning commute, eyes closed, trying to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMORY: Rachel steals up behind a Blonde Woman sitting at kitchen island. Suddenly, Rachel grabs her hair and throw her to the floor. FLASH - A silhouette runs through the underpass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel’s eyes snap open, startled. She tries to focus on her sketch book. She’s been drawing underpass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train disappears into a tunnel under the city streets INT. CHURCH OF ST. LUKE’S, NYC - MONDAY MORNING A group of about fifty people meet. Rachel is among them. DAVID is the facilitator. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Anyone counting days one to ninety who would like to share a day count?

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, I’m Jason, I’m an alcoholic.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP
dialogues.text: Hey, Jason. / Welcome, Jason.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’ve got twenty-two days back. The group applauds warmly.

dialogues.speaker: MODERATOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Anyone else? Rachel reluctantly raises her hand. She stands.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m Rachel, and...

dialogues.speaker: GROUP
dialogues.text: Welcome, Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: This is day one, I suppose. I’m here because I... (there’s no easy way to put this) Because I woke up this morning covered in blood. And I had bruises all over my arm and... It’s usually from when I’ve fallen and someone has helped me up. My husband... He used to tell me what I’d done the night before... And I learned that when you wake up like that, you just say you're sorry. You just say you're sorry for what you did and you're sorry for who you are and you're never gonna do it again. But you do. You do it again. Rachel swallows back tears.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: And there's... time missing. I need to remember. I need to remember. Rachel sits back down. On her face as David moves on. 27. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay. Thank you, Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: EVENING
dialogues.text: Rachel is in her seat. She notices a woman, MARTHA, board with some FEMALE FRIENDS. They’re laughing and gossiping. Rachel catches snippets.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: ...It was that homeless thing. I don’t remember what it was called.

dialogues.speaker: FRIEND
dialogues.text: Oh, Safe Shelter... That was a tube top, right?... Flustered, Rachel turns away in her seat before Martha ca see her. She remembers...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) Do you like Devil’s Eggs, Martha? INT. MARTHA’S HOUSE - DAY RACHEL’S MEMORY: Rachel is drunk at a barbecue, helping Martha arrange the food. Tom talks to his colleagues in t background. Martha notes Rachel’s drunkenness, disapprovi

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Deviled Eggs? Yeah, I do.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Deviled Eggs. Rachel playfully, but clumsily, walks a plate of deviled up to Tom and his colleagues.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: The classics. Do you want to try one, anybody?

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: (correcting) Those go outside. EXT. MARTHA’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Rachel puts the eggs down next to the desserts-- a little hard.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: I don’t want the eggs with the-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It doesn’t fucking matter where they go, okay? So do you want to put them here? She starts tossing individual eggs around the table.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Do you want them with your hot dogs? Or you can put a couple with your quinoa if you want. Or do you want to put them with your other salad and your corn, and a couple on the wall!

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Rachel-- Rachel grabs the whole ceramic platter of eggs and shatte it against the wall! Martha GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Rachel! Come on. He grabs Rachel and hustles her away from the party.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I'm fine, Tom. Stop it! You didn’t back me up. You never have my back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL’S MEMORY: Tom escorts Rachel by the arm towards Gr Central. Rachel can barely walk. She shrugs him off and points accusingly.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You never have my back.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: That’s my boss’s wife. You probably got me fired back there.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t give a fuck. I’m your wife. She shoves him away, hard.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m your wife and you never... you never fucking support me-- Tom staggers back, but tries to settle Rachel, taking her the arms. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Rachel, please stop. Hey, come on. (smiling) I need you to focus here. She slaps him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. RACHEL AND TOM’S HOUSE - NIGHT RACHEL’S FLASH MEMORY: Rachel, now in pajamas, charges at with a golf club, her eyes filled with fury.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Don’t fucking talk to me like that!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Relax! He ducks. The club smashes into a mirror. Glass rains dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel gets off the train, deliberately walking past the Liquor Store. EXT. RACHEL’S APARTMENT - LATER THAT EVENING Rachel walks up the stairs of her apartment. INT. RACHEL’S LIVING ROOM - SAME EVENING Rachel enters the apartment. Cathy runs to greet her. She surprisingly cheery.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: Rachel, there you are.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Cathy, I’m sorry. I need to get my shit together. I’m... Cathy raises a finger to her lips, indicating that Rachel needs to be quiet. In the living room stands a female cop, DETECTIVE RILEY, her partner, DETECTIVE GASKILL, both staring back at Rach

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You must be Ms. Watson. I’m Detective Riley. This is Detective Gaskill. We need to ask you a few questions. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel nods, unsure of what she’s just walked into.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What’s this about?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Want to sit down? Rachel sits, wary, as Riley settles in across from her.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Can you tell me where you were Friday night? A beat. Rachel, sweaty, searches for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I was at work in the city. And then... (beat) ...And then I went to visit my husband.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You mean your EX-husband?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (trying to keep her head together) .»--Yes. So I got off the train at Ardsley-on-Hudson. But then I decided that it was a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Around what time did you reach that conclusion? Unsure of what else to say, Rachel quickly comes up with:

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I was back here by 11:00. Rachel catches Cathy’s eye. Cathy knows Rachel is lying, she backs her.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: On your way back here, did you stop anywhere?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, fli Detective Rachel is 32.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: And what time did you take the train there?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (panicking to keep up) Um, 6:00.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: So...what did you do during those hours in Ardsley if you weren't seeing your ex-husband? ustered, has no answers. The silence drags on. Riley shows Rachel a PHOTO OF MEGAN.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Do you remember seeing this woman? shocked to see the photo of Megan.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: She worked for your ex-husband. She's gone missing.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What do you mean she’s missing?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Well, her husband said she never came back home the same night you got off the train in Ardsley-on- Hudson.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I was just...I was--

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Do you know Megan Hipwell?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (trapped) ...No.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Did you see her?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (rattled) No. I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Is that because you were inebriated? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel shakes her head with little confidence.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Just to clarify, you said you were at work Friday? Are you referring to your job in Public Relations?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (weakly) Right.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: It’s my understanding you were fired from that job over a year ago because of your drinking problem? A long silence. Gaskill nods to Riley: Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Ok. That’s enough for now. Cathy follows the detectives to the door. Rachel remains the couch, her mind racing.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: If you’re able to remember anything else, give us a call. Rachel doesn’t speak. Cathy shuts the door and spins arou

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: Did you really get fired? Rachel’s face is pale. Cathy is more curious than mad.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Look, I didn’t want you to worry that I couldn’t pay the rent...

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: If you don’t have a job, then what do you do everyday?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I... I ride the train.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I ride the train to New York and back. Cathy is now in complete disbelief. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: That’s what your alimony’s paying for? Tickets to nowhere? ... That's really fucking weird, Rachel!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. Rachel tries to focus.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I got on the train. And then...I got off the train. I don’t know! It’s very unclear...

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: You don’t remember anything, do you? Rachel’s face is molested with the realization that she h no idea what happened.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: You know, I read about this man in Long Island who blacked out. He left a bar and drove to the house that he’d grown up in...stabbed its occupants to death. Her voice starts to distort and fade as Rachel closes her eyes, trying to remember. FLASHBACK: Megan and Abdic on the balcony together.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: He woke up the next morning oblivious to what he did until the police came to get him. FLASHBACK: Megan’s lips brush against the Dark-Haired Man lips, then she kisses him deeply. BACK IN APARTMENT: Rachel’s eyes shoot open.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: (off Rachel’s non- response) Rachel!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: ...What? What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: You have to leave. I can’t do this anymore. I’ll give you a few weeks to-- ON RACHEL: Her mind racing.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (distracted) Hold on... Rachel darts out of the apartment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel runs out of the apartment, approaches Detective Ri who stands at her car talking to her partner.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (to Gaskill) .»-yeah, I agree with you, but--

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Detective Riley! Riley turns and walks towards Rachel. They meet in the street.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I saw someone with Megan Hipwell, but not on Friday night. Riley gives an almost imperceptible shake of her head.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: She was having an affair. She had a lover. That’s what I’m trying to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I thought you didn’t know her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. But I saw her.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You saw her where?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I saw her from the train. She was standing on the deck with this man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: With her husband, Scott Hipwell?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. It wasn’t him. This man was different. And they were kissing.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Wow. That’s pretty coincidental, isn’t it? You just happen to be on a train at the same exact moment that a woman you don’t know-- but somehow recognize-- is cheating on her husband? Rachel just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I know it sounds crazy, but--

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Neighbors saw a drunk woman in the vicinity of her house Friday night. Megan Hipwell does bear a resemblance to Anna Watson. Rachel braces herself for the accusation.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Watson reported that you go to their house sometimes uninvited. And that on one occasion, you actually broke in and took their child. Rachel is shocked at the thinly-veiled accusation.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Let me give you some advice. Don’t go back to Beckett Road. Don’t contact your ex-husband. Don’t go anywhere near Anna Watson or her baby. Rachel's mind is racing, trying to replay Friday night, b she can’t find the memories.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Are you listening to me?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You don’t live there anymore. Stay away. Riley walks away. ON RACHEL: Reeling.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) You know, I lie all the time.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Title: 4 MONTHS AGO INT. DR. ABDIC’S OFFICE - DAY Close on Megan as Dr. Abdic listens intently in the background.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I lie to Scott. I lie to you. I mean I know that’s not the point of therapy, but I have to keep things vague. Jumble up all the men, the Exes, the lovers. It doesn't matter who they are. It matters how they make me feel. Megan looks straight at Dr. Abdic.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Lying is like taking a trip. It’s like having a secret. It’s like touching yourself and no one else knows... Dr. Abdic watches as Megan slides up her skirt and runs h hand over her panties. She hangs her head back in bliss. MEGAN’S MEMORY: Our Megan of today is having sex in a hot room. She thrusts atop a man who is lying on his back in bed. We can’t see his face. BACK IN SESSION: A moment passes. Megan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Except you.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: But you’re just pretending. You’re just pretending to touch yourself. Diffused by Abdic, Megan moves on. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Scott’s possessive. Jealous. He likes to own me. He figures out all my passwords. Which is kinda sexy. Megan avoids Dr. Abdic’s penetrating stare.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: So, when I came home last night, Scott was on my laptop wondering why--

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Scott’s behavior is not normal. It’s a form of emotional abuse. Are you ever afraid of Scott?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: It’s not abuse. Not if you don’t care. And I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s become a normal state for you.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Is it normal I think about you all the time? Abdic doesn’t answer, just stands and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (reading the news, pre- lap) “Almost exactly a week ago, Megan Hipwell walked out of Number 15 Beckett Road and disappeared...”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel nervously scours the internet for details on Megan CLOSE ON I-PAD: Next to an article we see a photo of Mega standing in front of a large painting in the gallery wher she once worked.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (reading the news) “,..No one has seen her since. Neither her phone nor her bank cards have been used since Friday...” Rachel looks back to the seat where the Man In The Suit usually sits. An older bald man stares back blankly.  39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel now stands in front of the same painting we saw Me standing in front of. It is a painting of a woman standin suspiciously on a train platform. (The Subway by George Tooker. )

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (reading) “,..A wonderful woman. An intensely private person with a warm heart. She lost a brother when she was sixteen, and both her parents died a few years ago...” Rachel focuses intently on the painting, pushing in close and closer.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (reading) “Scott Hipwell urges anyone with information to please come forward.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel walks along the road. As she passes Anna’s house, sees: Anna in her window, watching her pass. ANNA’S POV: Rachel quickens her pace as she closes in on Number 15 Beckett Road. PRE-LAP: A door opens. EXT./INT. MEGAN AND SCOTT’S HOUSE - SAME MOMENT The door swings open, revealing Scott. He is the type of who, despite his distress, seems even sexier when disheve

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: You're Megan’s friend?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yes. Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Come in. Scott briskly enters the house. Rachel’s eyes drink in ev detail of the home.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Do you want a coffee? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Sure. Thank you. Scott guides Rachel to the kitchen table, covered in pape

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Sorry it’s a mess. I’ve been hunting for her social, birth certificate. The cops need a lot. Rachel takes a seat at the kitchen table. Scott stands by counter.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Have we met somewhere before?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: And you know Megan from?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Uh...from the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Are you an artist?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well, I like to think so. Rachel notices that there is a slight residue of lipstick the lip of the cup-- presumably Megan’s. Rachel turns the lipstick mark away from her, then steadi her nerves before taking a sip.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: (no time to spare) So you said on the phone...you wanted to tell me something about Megan. Rachel hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: What did you want to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I saw your wife with someone...on Friday morning. scott With who? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: She was up there on your porch. (pointing) I saw her from the train because I commute to Manhattan everyday and I go straight past here. Scott represses his reaction.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (hard to say) She kissed him. (a moment) They were kissing. This lands very hard on Scott. He lowers his head trying best to keep it together.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I know this is a terrible thing to hear. I know how it feels. Scott turns toward her, measured.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: What did he look like?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He was average height. He had dark- hair. Scott stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: And they were out there on the porch?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yes. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Fuck. Fuck. Scott opens the fridge and grabs a beer. He extends one t Rachel. She hesitates a moment: she really wants it.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No no no. Thank you. (changing her mind) ok. Sure. Scott hands her a beer. She takes a long pull. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: It could, I don’t know. Maybe it’s a good thing? It could mean she’s all right. (laughing, despite himself) She just ran off with someone.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Right. Scott takes a swig from his beer.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: (directly to Rachel) She talked to you?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (flustered) Oh no. I haven’t heard anything.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: You know her well enough to know where we live. Megan doesn’t have many friends.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well, I used to live nearby... She and I, we took yoga... we took pilates together. I think I should go, I feel like I’ve taken up too much of your time. So sorry to have had to tell you that in that way. Rachel pushes the beer away and starts to get up, but Sco places his hand on her wrist. She is immediately thrown o guard by being so close to him.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Do you think you'd recognize him again? If you saw him?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. NOW, Scott grabs his iPad and starts Googling.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: There was a guy, a therapist. His name’s Abdic? Abdic. Um, Kamal Abdic. Scott angles the iPad towards Rachel. INSERT iPAD SCREEN: A picture of Dr. Kamal Abdic. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Is that who you saw? Rachel stares at the image, trying to remember.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I really can’t tell.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: She spends a lot of fucking time with her shrink. Rachel scrolls through different images of Dr. Abdic on t internet. She pauses on a portrait-like photo of him. FLASHBACK: Megan and the Dark-Haired Man kiss. Up close. the same man.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (distorted, dream-like) I remember... BACK IN SCOTT’S KITCHEN:

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That’s him. Rachel turns to Scott, her face filled with a strange new excitement. There’s something intimate for her about help Scott:

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Title: 2 MONTHS AGO

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) Where are you? Where are you? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan sits alone in a hotel room with two different cell phones on the bed. She dials one of the phones while spea into the other. No answer. She leaves a message. Her voic strangely hopeful and broken at once, almost childlike, a she repeats a strange mantra.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Where are you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep in the forest, Megan has sex with a Man against a tr The trunk of the tree covers the Man’s face as he climaxe INT. SCOTT AND MEGAN’S KITCHEN - LATER SAME DAY Megan, in the same clothes, enters the house and finds Sc waiting at the kitchen table-- a stand-off and a portrait a troubled marriage. After a moment, she walks away. Scott springs up angrily follows, knocking over his chair.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Stay away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan is totally out of breath, trying to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (starting to cry) This is so stupid... He makes every conversation about getting pregnant. And every time we go there... Megan can’t bring herself to talk.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: To that subject. Dr. Abdic stands behind her and puts a hand on her should

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: What subject? Megan doesn’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Megan. What subject? She looks up at him, vulnerable. Then she wraps her arms around his waist to embrace him.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: (comforting) It’s okay. FLASH - A rustic cabin. Water drips from the ceiling. Meg startles awake in a bathtub. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Megan. FLASH - Megan screams and crawls naked from the tub. She tightens her embrace on Abdic.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Megan. All right, Megan. Dr. Abdic wraps his fingers around Megan’s wrists, trying remove her hands from his body.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: We shouldn't... Megan kisses Dr. Abdic’s hand, then she sucks his finger.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: No... Megan... Don’t make it impossible for us to work together. She stands and pulls him into a kiss. He resists.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Megan, I could lose my practice. She angrily shoves him away.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I don’t give a fuck. I don’t give a fuck about your fucking practice! He surges forward and grabs her tightly, starts berating in Spanish. She struggles and slaps at him, until he grab her face to look eye to eye. A moment as both of them absorb the weird intimacy of his rage at her. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel takes a brief break from shooting pool-- on the television there is news footage of Dr. Abdic peacefully being escorted from his home and getting into a detective car.

dialogues.speaker: NEWCASTER
dialogues.text: Dr. Kamal Abdic has been...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (overlapping) ---Dr. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kamal Abdic has been brought in for questioning on the disappearance of Ardsley-on-Hudson resident, Megan Hipwell. He was, according to sources, Mrs. Hipwell’s psychiatrist... Rachel leans over a pool table, taking aim with a cue. A DRUNKEN GUY hangs behind her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: For the first time in ages I have purpose. Rachel hits the ball into the pocket and celebrates with guy.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .--Or at least, I have a distraction... She continues to play and flirt with her opponent.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...I want Megan to show up safe and sound. I do. BING. Rachel looks down at her phone to find a TEXT FROM SCOTT: NEED TO MEET ASAP”

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .--dust not quite yet... Rachel rushes out. EXT./INT. SCOTT’S HOUSE - DAY Scott opens his door.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hi. He turns and she follows him inside to the living room.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Abdic’s been released.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What?! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: There wasn’t enough evidence. And because I’m the one that got him arrested, he talked. A lot.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: They’1l build a case against him, it’‘ll just take some time.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Are you totally sure he’s the guy you saw Megan with?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: .-.Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: You sure as fuck better be.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: The police think I did it.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, but he’s...

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: He told them Megan’s miserable...that I’m a jealous, controlling husband.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m sure that they’re just trying to rule you out before--

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Abdic told them I’m abusive. A new realization sets in. Scott leans against the wall. voice begins to crack.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: When she walked out, I didn't go after her. I never called to check on her. I went to a sports bar, for fuck’s sake, and got drunk.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. We just need to find more evidence on Abdic. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: I’ve spent the whole day going through her stuff. There’s no e- mails, there’s nothing, no letters, no emails. Nothing. For a second, I thought about contacting Abdic myself... The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Fucking phone won’t stop! Rachel is startled by his rage. Scott answers it.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: This is Scott... Yeah. Hold on. Hold on. (to Rachel) Do you mind? EXT. SCOTT’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Rachel walks from Scott’s house and sees Tom and Anna in their driveway getting out of the car. Rachel watches as goes to the backseat to retrieve Evie... She gets the bab out and SLAMS the car door. FLASHBACK: Rachel’s head SLAMS up against the wall of the underpass. BACK OUTSIDE TOM & ANNA’S HOUSE: Back in real time, Anna heads to the house.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (to Evie, playful) Oh, you're heavy. You’re a fatty. You're a little fatty. Tom turns and sees Rachel. He starts towards her, furious

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Rachel? No. (to Anna) Anna, Get in the house. Rachel fixates on Anna. As Anna turns-- FLASHBACK: In the underpass, Anna, wearing a red jacket, turns towards Rachel aggressively and strikes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tom reaches Rachel, she points towards Anna. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Your wife hit me on Friday night!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes she did. Rachel clocks Anna staring out the front door glass watch them.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (to Anna) Yes you did! (to Tom) And then she got in your car.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No. She said you yelled at her that night.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. That is not what happened! She was in the tunnel. And she hit me.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I won’t argue in the street. The middle of the day...and you're drunk. Tom starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (straightening up) I’m not drunk, Tom!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (turning back to Rachel) My wife is scared of you. Hearing the word “Wife” is like being punched in the gut.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I don’t even know if that’s a joke or not. Let’s start with child abduction.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That’s bullshit. You know that’s not... how it happened. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You and I both know what you’re capable of. Pause. They look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You were just at Scott Hipwell’s house? Rachel searches for a lie she doesn’t have.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Why are you at Scott Hipwell’s house?!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Because I’m helping him.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: To try and find Megan.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You don't even know Megan! Beat. He softens.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Rach. I don’t think you're helping anybody. INT. DR. KAMAL ABDIC’S OFFICE - THE NEXT DAY Dr. Abdic talks to a patient. There’s a newfound sadness him. After a night of questioning, he’s frustrated and doesn’t at all seem like the same man who sat across from Megan. Finally he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: So you're here because you want to uncover lost memories. Is that correct? Now, we see that it’s RACHEL SITTING ACROSS FROM HIM. Tho she has circles under her eyes, she’s tried to clean hers up for her first session with Abdic.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (his accent) You have an accent? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Pardon? She studies Dr. Abdic’s every move.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Sorry. I wasn’t expecting you to have an accent.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Well, you have an accent.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: (losing patience) I’m an American citizen. But I guess you’re not here to talk about me. Unless, you are...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. I’m sorry. I was just trying to make conversation.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) The blackouts. You’re experiencing blackouts. Dr. Abdic moves forward in his seat. Rachel’s blood goes cold.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Do you want to tell me about them? She shifts awkwardly in her seat.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well, when I wake up, and when someone tells me what I’ve done, it just doesn’t feel like me or like something that I would do. I feel bad about it. But it’s like it’s so far removed that I have a... I just don’t feel bad enough. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: You want to take personal responsibility for what you've done, but you find it difficult to feel accountable because you can’t even remember it. Yeah? Rachel, dumbstruck, feels understood for the first time. She smiles Rachel is

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: ...yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: So, Rachel, besides drinking-- because you clearly drink. You've been drinking today, haven’t you? awkwardly, caught.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: What else do you enjoy? Do you have any hobbies?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I like to draw. Art, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Good. We can try to regain some of your memories by drawing them--

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I've tried it. It doesn’t work.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Have you ever tracked all the way back to when you started drinking heavily? When was that? reluctant to actually delve into therapy.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: ...It was with Tom. When I couldn’t get pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Who's “Tom?”

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He’s my ex-husband.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Do you want to talk about that?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I really wanted a baby. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dr. Abdic’s arresting stare forces Rachel to continue:

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We tried everything and nothing worked. And it just absolutely... She starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It just broke my heart. So I got really sad and then the booze just broke us... Rachel is gutted.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: Okay. Tell me more.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I used to watch this perfect couple. And they were just the embodiment of true love. It’s like the kind of love you always want. And then, she betrayed him. And it’s sparked something in me... Rachel has just placed her head into the lion’s mouth. A moment. Abdic senses an agenda.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: (no bullshit) Why are you really here, Rachel? Her true emotions take over.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Because I’m afraid of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna pushes Evie in a stroller toward the Beckett Road underpass.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) July 5th: 1:33, 1:34, 1:37... Anna and Evie emerge from inside underpass. INT. POLICE STATION, RILEY’S DESK - DAY Anna sits across from Riley with Evie in her stroller. Ri peruses a stapled phone bill covered in red underlines. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: She calls again 1:38 and then she calls again at 1:44, 1:45, 2:15 PM. And then July 6th... You get the point. She sometimes texted him dozens of times a day.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (looking at the bill) But these are all from an unknown number.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Unknown is Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You have a log of the calls. You don’t have a log of what they’re saying to each other. On Anna, thrown off by the implication. Riley scof

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Look, has she been back to the house since the incident with your child?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Not that I know.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Well, then you might have a case for harassment in the second degree, but these are texts, they’re not threats, so...

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (interrupting) She's been hanging around Scott Hipwell’s house. A lot.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (encouraging her) I’m aware. There are a lot of loose ends here that suggest something, but they don’t add up to much. If you can bring me something more solid...

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What more do you need? fs at the phone bills laid out before her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Evidence. Real evidence? After a moment.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You sure your husband doesn’t want to stay in touch with his ex-wife?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What? No. She’s harassing us.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Is that what he calls it? On Anna, insulted by the implication. INT. TOM AND ANNA’S FAMILY ROOM - LATER THAT DAY Anna sits at a table with a glass of red wine. She takes gulp, pensive for a beat. The log-in screen appears on a desktop computer, with Tom photo. Anna stares at the blank space next to the PASSWOR header. She lets out a deep breath, thinks for a second-- --She types “EVIE,” and then ENTER. A message POPS UP: “PASSWORD INCORRECT.” Anna tries again: “ANNA,” and presses ENTER. The same “PASSWORD INCORRECT” message pops up. Something occurs to Anna. She downs the remaining wine. She takes a deep breath to calm her nerves, then... ...She types “RACHEL.” She hesitates a beat. She sighs, t hits ENTER. This time, she’s relieved when she is met wit the “PASSWORD INCORRECT” message. Tom's keys RATTLE outside. Shit. Anna takes her wine, moves to the kitchen table and prete to be engrossed in a magazine... .--Just as Tom enters.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Hey. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They kiss. When he leaves, Anna lets her worry show. INT. RACHEL’S ROOM - EVENING The news is playing loudly on the television. Rachel is surrounded by drawings of the underpass and the blonde woman. There’s a BANGING! INT. RACHEL’S APARTMENT - MOMENTS LATER Rachel opens the door, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hi. It’s Scott. He’s very troubled. Completely caught off gua Rachel just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Reporters are in my yard. Everywhere. I didn’t know where else to go.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Come in. LATER: Rachel and Scott sit in the living room, holding steaming coffee mugs. Deep in thought, Scott shakes his h

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: The detective just... The detective just told me something I’ve wanted to hear for a long time. It’s hard for Scott to continue.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: She’s pregnant. She told her shrink but not me. Rachel takes a pained breath.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: I wanted a family, but she fought me every step of the way. We always fought about it. An awkward moment.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: ...-Did Megan ever say anything about me to you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel pauses.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (wide-eyed) She loved you. She loved you in ways that people only dream of being loved. INT. RACHEL’S ROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT LATER: Scott sleeps peacefully in Rachel’s bed. BOOM! The camera jumps back to reveal a wide shot: Rachel standing above Scott, watching him sleep. Rachel slowly sits down next to him and hesitantly places hand on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Title: 1 MONTH AGO INT. SCOTT AND MEGAN’S HOUSE - NIGHT CLOSE ON: Scott’s sleeping face in profile. He turns to reveal Megan, awake. Mascara and tears stream down her cheeks. She quietly sne out of bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open. Dr. Abdic stands there in a t-shirt sweatpants, taken aback by Megan, who wears a coat over h nightgown.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC
dialogues.text: (looking around for neighbors) You shouldn’t be here.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (pushing her way in) I just... I need to tell someone, just once. Just say it out loud. I want to tell you. And then I’1l1 be gone, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan moves past Dr. Abdic, through his home, searching i dark corners, until she ends up in his living room. Dr. Abdic catches up with her. They stand across the room from one another, in the dark. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I got pregnant. I was seventeen. I had her by myself. She had dark eyes and blond hair. I expected it to be hard, but it wasn’t. It was easy. Because I loved her. I loved her. I called her Elizabeth. Libby. (a moment) ...Libby. (a moment) It was December. We’d gotten in a fight, me and Mac. He'd gone off and left. MEGAN’S MEMORY: Water seeps through the ceiling of a hunt cabin as it rains outside. The much younger Megan is asle in the tub.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (in a trance) The roof was leaking. I was freezing cold, so I got in the tub. I brought Libby in with me, put her on my chest... BACK IN DR. ABDIC’S HOUSE: Megan continues her story.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: .+-her head just under my chin. (a moment) I fell asleep. MEGAN’S MEMORY: Megan stirs awake in the tub.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I let her go. I let her go. Megan jumps out of the tub screaming. She runs from the bathroom and outside the cabin. BACK IN DR. ABDIC’S HOUSE: Megan breaks down.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I let her go. I let her go. MEGAN’S MEMORY: She scrambles out of the tub, across the floor, and out into the freezing rain. Naked and distraug

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I couldn’t look. I didn’t want to see it. I didn’t want to see her like that. BACK IN DR. ABDIC’S HOUSE: Megan tries to regain control. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: So one day when I was drunk, I decided to go there. INT. TOM AND ANNA’S FAMILY ROOM - DAY - MEMORY Rachel enters the house again.

dialogues.text: INT. RACHEL’S HOUSE - LATE AFTERNOON Rachel enters her duplex. She hangs up her coat and scarf pulls up short, startled.
