I would never even get near someone like you! My wife is dead, and you’re lying to me!? What’s wrong with you?? Who does this?? Rachel backs into the kitchen. Scott follows.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL

dialogues.text: With the doctor?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I wanted to know about Abdic and I went to him to help you-- Scott grabs Rachel by her head and covers her mouth. She YELPS. He violently pushes her into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: You're just a sad liar with no life. You're all liars.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (through his hand) Please don’t! Scott squeezes harder, then lets go and storms out, leavi Rachel terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, out of breath, runs into the police station. She approaches the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I need to file a statement...

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Rachel Watson. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Pete? I got this. Rachel turns to see Riley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley opens the door of a police station bathroom and sig Rachel inside. Riley crosses to the sink and looks into the mirror above for a long beat. Uneasy, Rachel walks towards Riley.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You wanted to file a statement? I’m listening.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Scott Hipwell just assaulted me.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You mean your new boyfriend Scott Hipwell?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. We were just friends.

dialogues.text: But that’s what you wanted, isn’t it? I mean, you got him to stay overnight at your apartment, right?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. You need... You need the context. Riley turns from the mirror and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I know the context. But what I’m trying to determine is when your obsession with Mr. Hipwell began. Was it before or after his pregnant wife was murdered? I mean, you were neighbors at one point?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I met him after... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: After being questioned by me, you befriend another even more obvious suspect than yourself, and then you manage to get him to incriminate himself all the while hoping he’11l fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I came here trying to help you. He just assaulted me in my own house!

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You were seen in the area that night. There are several hours that you say you can’t account for. This is news to Rachel. Her resolve begins to unsettle. She moves

dialogues.text: It was Scott. Scott Hipwell killed his wife.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: No. He didn’t. Surveillance footage from a sports bar accounts for Mr. Hipwell’s whereabouts that night. in, quietly insistent.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You're lying. You’re lying. Rachel is terrified. Riley puts a comforting hand on her Riley lean

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t know... s in close to Rachel’s face. She’s calm.

dialogues.text: Did you murder Megan Hipwell? A moment. Rachel realizes she doesn’t know the answer. Sh flees ina panic.

dialogues.text: Title: LAST FRIDAY  69. INT. MEGAN AND SCOTT’S BATHROOM - EARLY MORNING Megan sits on the closed toilet seat, pregnancy test in h leaving a message on her phone.

dialogues.text: (into phone) Hi. I need to see you. Can you please come over? She hangs up, drops the test, and puts her head in her ha She looks up and finds herself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Forgive yourself. He steps out behind her and folds her into an embrace. In distance behind them, the train passes.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ABDIC

The train starts to pull away from the station. Rachel ge out of her seat, rushes down the aisle to try to keep the view.

dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Rachel sits at the bar. The Bartender places a Martini down in front of her. She closes her eyes, brings the glass to her lips and sucks d half the glass, the liquor burning her and filling her wi life. Rachel looks around at the uppity Ardsley crowd. Down at end of the bar, she notices The Man In The Suit. Fear and trepidation washes over her. Their eyes meet. He smirks. Rachel finishes her drink. She musters up all the courage inside her and walks over to him. The Man In The Suit turns towards her.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN THE SUIT
dialogues.text: Whoa. Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I need you to tell me the fucking truth. What did you see that night? What happened that night? Rachel can see he has no idea what she is talking about a her face goes pale. He stands.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN THE SUIT
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I’m assuming it’s the worst. The Man In The Suit walks out the door. Rachel puts her h in her hands. She’s fucked.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: God...

dialogues.text: (from phone) ...I wonder if she knows that I fucked Tom... When I saw that woman kissing someone else, betraying her husband. I felt it. FLASH INSERT: Megan on her back porch, stretching in her robe.

dialogues.text: (from phone) ...then I’d pull her down... FLASH INSERT: Rachel SMASHES Megan’s skull into the blue tiles, blood splashing everywhere.

dialogues.text: (laughing) ...-It’s so true. It’s the worst restaurant ever. Why do we keep going back? Rachel looks down. Then, breathing heavily, she slowly li her eyes and approaches.

dialogues.text: Anna sits on her bed with Tom’s laptop, trying more passwords. After a few more unsuccessful attempts, she places the la back into Tom’s bag. It bumps against something. An OLD CELLPHONE. The phone gives her pause. She inspects it a second, then holds down its POWER butto It doesn’t turn on. She thinks of something.

Stuck watching Evie.” Starting to shake, Anna scrolls down through more message Anna hears the JANGLING of keys from outside. She quickly stands, stashing the phone and charger in a cookie tin. FLASHBACK: Anna slaps Rachel across the face, then sprint away through the underpass... Rachel crawls out of a drai ditch and sets off after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna stares at Tom, watching his sleepy chest rise and fa When she is satisfied that he is completely asleep, Anna quietly slips out of bed.  79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna, wearing a white silk robe, stands in the kitchen wi the cell phone. She turns the phone over and over in her hand, debating what to do. Finally, she hits the CONTACTS icon, but the only contact are EMERGENCY and VOICE-MAIL. She hits the VOICE-MAIL ent then places the phone to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna stands outside, listening to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (from the phone) No new messages. No saved messages. To hear your current voice-mail greeting, please press TWO. Anna hits the number TWO, then returns it to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Hi, it’s Megan. Leave a message. Anna’s heart is in her throat.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (from the phone) To replay this greeting, press ONE. Anna hits the number ONE again, pressing the phone agains her ear, even harder this time.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Hi, it’s Megan. Leave a message. Above Anna, the upstairs bedroom light turns on. Then downstairs in the kitchen... Anna sees the lit-up window. Shit. EXT. TOM AND ANNA’S BACK YARD - SAME NIGHT Panicked, Anna hurls the cell phone over the back fence. Behind Anna, the screen door opens and Tom steps outside.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You okay? There’s a moment of silence between them. Anna’s unsure h to respond. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I thought I heard something. Neither makes the attempt to bridge the distance between them.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You should wake me up if you heard something.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I just--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Come back to bed. Anna doesn’t move for a moment. She’s unsure of what this means-- what she’s walking into. She walks across the distance to Tom. Past him. Leaving h puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is hyperventilating as she arrives at the underpas FLASHBACK: The woman in the red jacket walks through the underpass, headed for a car parked at the far end. Rachel follows her, remembering. FLASHBACK: Teens blow smoke into Rachel’s face. FLASHBACK: The Man in the Suit leans down over her. FLASHBACK: We hear heels clacking through the underpass. woman in red keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Whore! The woman in red turns back towards Rachel. NOW, Rachel stops as the memory snaps into focus.

dialogues.speaker: AS THE FLASHBACK PLAYS OUT IN FULL
dialogues.text: The woman turns. It is Megan, in a red jacket! Rachel continues drunkenly through the overpass and hears Megan speak to the man in the car. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Rachel’s down there. And now the man is striding angrily towards Rachel while Megan waits by the car. It’s Tom. Tom charges through the underpass toward Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (to Rachel) What the hell are you doing? He grabs her roughly by the arm and leads her out of the underpass. Rachel lashes out with one arm, but misses. Tom shoves Rachel to the side of the underpass down into drainage ditch. He throws her against the wall and she slumps to the grou He stands over her with his keys dangling from a leather He hits her with his keys and then runs back through the underpass. Rachel crawls out of the drainage ditch and back into the underpass. She watches as Megan gets in the car. Tom spee the car away. Two smirking teens walk up to Megan, amused by her drunkenness. One squats down to blow smoke in her face. The Man in the Suit walks towards them.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN THE SUIT
dialogues.text: (to the teens) Hey, get the fuck out of here. Get the fuck out of here! He turns to help Rachel up.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN THE SUIT
dialogues.text: You're okay. You just need some help.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Don’t touch me... Don’t touch me... Just fuck off... FUCK OFF!! He leaves, heading off through the underpass. BACK TO PRESENT: Rachel sits against the wall of the underpass, processing what she has remembered.  82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tracks curve past the river with no train in sight. W rustles through the weeds and through the trees of Becket Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birds chirp. Rachel stands in front of Tom and Anna’s hou She steps onto the lawn and walks towards the house. Rachel walks around the side of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel steels herself as she enters the yard.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (to Evie) Come on. You’re heavy. Hello. Aw, come here... Anna is playing with Evie in a sandbox. She looks like he Her face is pale and makeup-less, her eyes blood-shot red Rachel appears from the side of the house.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Anna.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No. No. No. Go away. Go. Anna rises.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Anna, please. Please. I’m just going to stand right here. I’m not gonna come closer. I just need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I don’t want to hear anything you have to say.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Where’s Tom? Anna stares back at Rachel, carefully watching the distan between them. She doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He’s lying to you. He always does. He’s a good liar. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I know he’s a good liar. We went behind your back for months. Rachel absorbs this. Anna looks away from her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He’s just done it to you--

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (cutting Rachel off) I know he’s cheating... I know... Rachel wasn’t expecting this... Behind them, the train passes. Then.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Anna... He killed Megan.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (furious) No, we don’t... We don’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He’s dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: We don’t know anything!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Anna, you need to leave. You need to leave. You need to take Evie and you need to leave. Get out of here. Anna shakes her head, trying to resist the solidarity gro between them.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No... No...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It’s not safe.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I’m not leaving him. It’s hardly the first time he’s had an affair.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It’s not about the affair. And you know that, deep down. Anna, please just come with me.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I’m not leaving him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Please come with me. The back door opens. Rachel and Anna turn to see Tom stan there.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come in the house, honey. Anna runs with Evie towards Tom.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Anna, don’t. Don’t! Please... Anna passes Tom and disappears inside. Tom shakes his head at Rachel and turns to go inside. Rachel rushes toward Tom.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I saw you, Tom. You motherfucker, I saw you! You murderer! Tom slams the door in Rachel's face. She shouts at him through the glass.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You fucking murderer! You killed her! You fucking killed her, I know it! Tom opens the door and pulls Rachel inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom pushes Rachel into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You're un-fucking-believable. Anna stands shocked in the corner holding Evie tightly.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (to Anna) Now listen. Listen to me. Megan got into his car that night. (to Tom) You think I don’t remember. You thought I blacked out. I saw you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (to Tom) Why did Megan get in your car? Did Megan get in your car? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yes, she did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Tell her the truth. Just tell her the truth right now... You attacked me in that tunnel, because I saw her with you-- Anna interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (hard to say) ...I found Megan’s phone. The room goes silent. Tom and Rachel turn to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I found it... (beat) So, all those phone calls... They weren’t from Rachel... Tom walks away from Rachel and out into the sitting area.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: So were you fucking her while she was here, working? While she was looking after our daughter?!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: ...-You were so tired all the time. He approaches Evie who is sitting in a jumpy chair. He pi her up and she starts crying loudly.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It’s all about Evie... (to Evie) That’s right. It was all about you, wasn’t it? He glares at Anna, pulling Evie closer to his chest. Anna panics.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Tom, give her to me.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It’s all right. (to Evie) It was all about you, wasn’t it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Tom, give her to me. Please. Please give her to me.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: She’s fine. Anna cautiously approaches, reaching out for Evie. Tom tu from her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I think she needs changing. Please?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It’s gonna be fine.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Please just give her to me. Anna gently takes Evie from Tom, but Tom clutches Evie by arm. Not letting go.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Let her go. You’re going to hurt her.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Change her here.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Okay, I’1l change her. Let her go. You’re gonna hurt her. With Tom distracted, Rachel reaches into her pocket and withdraws her phone, shakily dials 911-- Rachel slowly leaves the kitchen, heading towards the hallway... Still clutching Evie by the arm, Tom guides the baby towa the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel places the phone to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (on phone) 911, what’s your--? Tom suddenly grabs Rachel and spins her around. He grabs the phone from Rachel’s hands. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (on phone) What’s your emergency? He hangs up. Tom grabs Rachel by the back of her neck and forces her o of the living room and back toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom forces Rachel back into the kitchen and pushes her do to a stool at the kitchen island. Anna tries to leave wit Evie.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (to Anna) No no, stay. Stay. They stand in silence. Tom turns to Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Do you need a drink?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. Tom notices Rachel's hands are shaking slightly. He cover them with his own hand.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah you do. Tom goes to the fridge and pulls out a fifth of vodka. He fills a glass.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: All those things that you said I did. Those terrible things. I didn't do any of them. Anna says nothing. He walks over to Rachel with glass.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You just watched me suffer. You made me feel so worthless. You made me think that everything was my fault. Anna says nothing. Tom slides the vodka in front of Rachel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Drink it.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You told me I got you fired. But, I didn’t. She looks beyond Tom to Anna who is listening behind him Evie.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, I saw Martha on the train?

dialogues.speaker: DRINK IT.
dialogues.text: Tom throws the newly poured drink at Rachel. Vodka drips her face. Not backing down, she looks to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I_saw Martha on the train. And she told me that you were fired because you were fucking everyone in the office! Tom smashes the glass on Rachel’s head. She falls hard to floor. Her eyes close. Evie begins crying. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel’s memory slowly fades back in. The moment when Meg is walking away from her. This time we stay with Megan as she reaches Tom’s car.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Rachel’s down there.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Wait here. He heads down the underpass and disappears. Megan stands next to Tom’s car. Waiting. Finally, he emer from the trees next to the underpass.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You want to get in the car?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: What’s going on? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it. Come on. They drive away. At the other end of the underpass, Rachel drags herself o of the ditch and watches them leave. INT. TOM’S CAR - MOMENTS LATER Tom glances over at Megan.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Okay, I’m here. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I just want to go to the woods. Megan stares out the window at the trees as they drive de into the woods. Rain drops obscure the image. There’s a sadness to Megan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Megan walk through the trees in the rain. Megan l him. TOM’S POV: Megan runs ahead and turns around, smiling lik siren.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (playful) What is it with you crazy women? NOW, Megan leans against the tree that she and Tom had se against. MEGAN’S MEMORY: Megan has sex against the tree. But now t Man’s face is no longer obscured. We see it is Tom. MEGAN’S MEMORY: Megan and Tom have sex in the hotel room. MEGAN’S MEMORY: Tom has sex with Megan in the nursery, Ev watching from her crib. A music box lullaby plays.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN FOREST
dialogues.text: Tom is now pressed up against Megan. He kisses her. The lullaby continues in the background. Water drips from branch onto Megan’s face, bringing her back to herself.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Is this what you want? (CONTINUED)
He unbuttons his pants and begins to tug at her jeans.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: No. Tom smirks and spins her around so she’s facing the tree.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Like this? Megan gently pushes him back and turns to him. A moment. Megan struggles with how to articulate something.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I’m pregnant. Tom’s face is blank. Megan says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I thought you should know.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You thought I should know?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: There’s a chance it could be yours. Tom stares at her a beat.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Then get an abortion. Or if it’s Scott’s, do whatever you want. But if it’s not then... Get rid of it. Tom walks away from Megan at the tree. Megan crosses from the tree.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You can be as involved as you want. Tom tenses up.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (softening) You're a shitty nanny. What makes you think you’re gonna be a good mother? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Why did you bring me there in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Because I thought it would be fun to have you both around. Tom grabs Megan’s hand and tries to pull her back to the Megan yanks away.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I played your game so you could fuck me in between Evie’s playdates.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I don’t need another kid. Certainly not with you. He turns and starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I took care of your kid to be near you! Megan pushes Tom hard. He stumbles forward and onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You fucked Anna because you couldn’t fuck Rachel anymore! And you fucked me because you couldn’t fuck Anna! Take us all away and you're just a pathetic, impotent man! Tom shoves Megan backwards into the ground. HER HEAD SLAM INTO A ROCK. Blood spills onto the forest floor. Tom stands over Megan. All is silent. She's dizzy and disoriented. After a moment -

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You’re not gonna get rid of me. You're gonna pay for this child for the rest of your life-- Tom raises his foot and smashes his heel HARD into Megan’ head. Then he raises his foot and does it again. Megan lies still. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tom looks around to see that they’re alone. He grabs Mega her feet and drags her back to the uprooted tree. Tom shoves Megan under the root ball. She stirs. Her eyes look back at him. She begins to SCREAM. Tom spots a rock on the forest floor. A resolve settles on Tom’s face. He has to finish this. H grips the rock... He leans under the root ball and smashe Megan’s head again. And again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Rachel’s face resting on the kitchen floor. Slo she opens her eyes and sees Tom on the couch. He gazes at her. After a long pause--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You're like a dog. Like one of those unwanted, mistreated dogs. You can kick them, but they keep coming back to you. Thinking that somehow if they’re good--

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You're not doing this again.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: --you’ll love them. Weak, Rachel manages to sit, her back against the kitchen counter.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: This is what you do. You’re not doing this to me.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You brought this on yourself, Rachel. If you had just stayed away that one night... Just left us all alone. You brought this on Megan... In a way, you killed her. A long silence between them.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: But I didn’t. (beat) You did. Rachel BOLTS out of the kitchen, grabbing the corkscrew o the refrigerator. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just as she reaches the front door, Tom catches her and begins to choke her. Dropping the cork-screw, Rachel trie pry his hands from her neck.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You did this to me in our marriage. You made me fucking crazy. Still choking her, Tom drives her to her knees. Rachel lo up the stairs to see... Anna-- staring blankly as Tom continues to choke Rachel. Rachel pleads for help with her eyes but Anna just stares back with little emotion.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what it’s like to be married to a fucking blur? Tom forces her head to the floor. Quickly losing consciousness, Rachel flails her arms, searching for the corkscrew. Her hand finds an umbrella stand. She grabs th leg of the stand and swings the entire unit toward Tom, striking his head. Dazed, Tom lets go. Grabbing the corkscrew, Rachel runs b down the hall and out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel runs through the backyard, towards the back fence the train tracks. Tom chases after, catches up to her, and grabs her by the arm. He yanks her backwards, HARD. Rachel reels on him, swinging her other arm around toward him with a clenched fist... JAMMING THE CORKSCREW INTO TOM’S NECK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .-.-Tom stares straight at Rachel. Blood spurts from his wound! Still standing Tom leans into Rachel. Each is forced to p their arms around each other in an awkward embrace. Blood continues to flow from his neck. Together they lower to their knees on the lawn. Anna watches in shock from the upstairs window. Rachel lets go of Tom. He falls to the ground. Rachel rises and turns to the train as it barrels past on tracks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel turns to see Anna walking towards a squirming Tom. women lock eyes. Anna falls to her knees beside Tom. Rachel slowly approaches. Anna is not trying to stop the bleeding at all...

dialogues.speaker: ...INSTEAD ANNA IS TWISTING THE CORKSCREW DEEPER AND DEEP
dialogues.text: INTO TOM’S NECK. Tom dies. Anna stands. The two women face each other in silence. EXT. TOM AND ANNA’S HOUSE - LATER Detectives Riley and Gaskill escort Anna and Rachel to a waiting squad car. Rachel looks up to see Scott standing in the lawn next do Scott stares at Rachel stopping her in her tracks. She and Scott share a knowing look. Without words, much i said and forgiven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley and two Police Officers lead Rachel and Anna into t station. As they are led into different rooms, Rachel and Anna sha one final glance. They are now tied together, forever bound, by the stories they tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley and Gaskill videotape Rachel’s statement.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I had no choice. He was... He would have killed me. I never wanted to hurt him. It was self-defense. Pushing in on Riley, we turn to see Anna is now at the ta giving her statement.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: She had no choice. Tom would have killed her. I saw the whole thing. Rachel was right about Megan. She was right about everything.  95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, looking more put together than we’ve seen, makes way towards a low headstone: “MEGAN HIPWELL 1990-2016” She silently pays her respects.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We are tied forever now, the three of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits, sketching before the Dancing Maids Fountain. fountain isn’t flowing.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bound forever by the story we share. CLOSE SHOTS ON: The Three Maid’s faces and dancing bodies preserved as a relic of the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trees blur as the train rolls by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits looking out the window of the train. She sees houses on Beckett Road drift by as the train passes, then turns to look out the other window.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Today, I sit in a different car. And I look ahead. Anything is possible. Because I am not the girl I used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train continues onward, curving along the river to disappear beyond the trees. FADE OUT.
